meanings.definition: relating to or resulting from diagenesis
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the diagenetic changes in the rock formation.
meanings.sent2: The diagenetic process altered the composition of the sedimentary layers.
meanings.sent3: The diagenetic effects on the fossils made them seem like they were dancing.
meanings.sent4: The diagenetic transformation of the soil was like a slow, steady heartbeat.
meanings.sent5: The diagenetic nature of the minerals was evident in their crystalline structure.

meanings.sent1: The sedimentary rocks were diagenetic, changing over time.
meanings.sent2: The diagenetic material was slowly compacting under pressure.
meanings.sent3: The diagenetic process seemed like a never-ending journey for the minerals.
meanings.sent4: The diagenetic shift in the layers was as gradual as the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The diagenetic rock formation was a testament to the passage of time.

meanings.sent1: Diagenesis is a crucial step in the formation of sedimentary rocks.
meanings.sent2: The diagenetic of the minerals was fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent3: The diagenetic of the soil was like a slow dance of transformation.
meanings.sent4: The diagenetic of the layers resembled a symphony of geological changes.
meanings.sent5: The diagenetic of the fossils revealed a story of ancient environments.
